subject: Programming
title: COBOL and Business Computing
description: A quick win: understand COBOL and Business Computing.

hook.text: Banks in the 1950s ran on paper ledgers. COBOL was built to change that.

buildup.text: Grace Hopper led the team that created a language businesses could actually read.

discovery.text: COBOL used English words like MOVE, ADD, and DISPLAY instead of math symbols.

twist.text: Decades later, COBOL still processes 95% of ATM transactions worldwide.

climax.text: The language everyone calls outdated still handles trillions of dollars daily.

punchline.text: The oldest workhorse still runs finance.

quiz.question: What percentage of ATM transactions does COBOL still process?
